definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate

sentences.english: It is reflected in the mind as 'I am', as the ornament's particular name and shape.
sentences.chinese: 它在头脑中反映为本觉，好比金饰的个别名相。

sentences.english: Maintain complete knowledge of all beverage selections, correct glassware and garnishes in the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 熟知餐厅的酒水及相应的杯子和装金饰。

sentences.english: Ancient records on decorative gold are missing, and so it is difficult to sketch the outlines of its development.
sentences.chinese: 古代金饰记载缺佚，其发展状况实难廓清。

sentences.english: Do not adorn yourselves outwardly by braiding your hair, by wearing gold ornaments,or fine clothing.
sentences.chinese: 你们不要以外面的辫头发，戴金饰，穿美衣，为妆饰。

sentences.english: Daughters from the majority Hindu population are traditionally given gold ornaments for their marriage.
sentences.chinese: 大多数印度人家女儿出嫁时，都要赠送黄金饰品。

sentences.english: Women are sitting in the shadow and holding golden goods on their knees.
sentences.chinese: 妇女们坐在在阴凉的地方，膝盖上放着黄金饰品。

sentences.english: This means the sharp price surge in gold products is reasonable.
sentences.chinese: 这样，金饰品价格提升乃是意料中事。

sentences.english: They adulterated the high-quality gold ornaments to reap fabulous profits.
sentences.chinese: 高档黄金饰品中掺假以牟取暴利。

sentences.english: Learning to the prudent is as an ornament of gold, and like a bracelet upon his right arm.
sentences.chinese: 纪律为明智人，有如金饰品，又如右臂上的手镯。

sentences.english: There were traces of gold decoration on the vessels.
sentences.chinese: 有痕迹的黄金饰品的血管。

sentences.english: Tourists are lingering on the soft sand and enjoying natural tropical plants.
sentences.chinese: 金饰的白沙岸和天然的热带植物王国让游人乐而忘返。

sentences.english: Platinum jewelry from both Neil Lane and Beaudry Continue.
sentences.chinese: 白金饰品尼尔从地里马尔继续。
